abstract:
This talk will consist of two main parts. After outlining the difficulty
of annual reviews with a real life example, I will explain the manual
solution of success statements. A success statement is a sentence that
explains a single achievement and how it contributes to the bottom line.
This is a great place to start, but can be tedious to add up all the
information for reports. The second part is about the app I created and
how you can use it to store and automatically summarize the data
multiple ways. I’ll get into the different ways to manipulate the data
and how to deploy the app to have a personal ROI Tracker.
description:
Most people dread the annual review process. It is difficult to remember
everything you have done and summarize it in a concise, clear way. As
engineers, there is the additional factor of translating technical
achievements into a format business folks can understand. I propose a
solution for tracking and reporting achievements in a way that’s simple
and easy for stakeholders to understand.
title: Using Data to Get Your Next Raise
